intro: Euploca mutica, commonly known as the rough euploca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and rough, hairy leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Euploca mutica is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
